page.title: 08Recreation in Knowle
page.content: The{Knowle area of Bristol}provides a number of facilites for recreation, some private clubs and others public. The largest is the{Imperial Sports } {Ground}founded in 1904 by the famous tobacco manufacturing family of{Wills for the use of their employees. It has been so successful that larger pavilions are now being built. There are football and rugby pitches, indoor squash courts and, most widely known, a cricket club. The high standard of facilities allows County teams to play here and great consternation was caused when it seemed that new ring road plans might affect the grounds. {Knowle cricket and tennis clubs}form another important private area for the sports people of Knowle.{Redcatch Park however, has swings and slides for local youngsters, bowling greens for adults and relaxation for all.
